intro: Maba littorea, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to coastal regions of the Indo-Pacific. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or muddy soils near the shoreline, adapting well to saline environments. Its flowers are often pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Maba littorea is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local cultures.
